citation.article-title: Reclassification of [Pseudomonas] doudoroffii (Baumann et al. 1983) into the genus Oceanomonas gen. nov. as Oceanomonas doudoroffii comb. nov., and description of a phenol-degrading bacterium from estuarine water as Oceanomonas baumannii sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Oceanomonas (O.ce.a.no.mo'nas. Gr. n. okeanus ocean; Gr. fem. n. monas monad, unit; M.L. fem. n. Oceanomonas ocean monad)
Cells are straight rods, 0.7-1.2x2.0-2.5 Î¼m, motile by one to four polar flagella.
Gram-negative, chemoorganotrophs with an absolute requirement for Na+ for growth.
Metabolism is obligately respiratory with molecular oxygen as the terminal electron acceptor.
The major phospholipids are phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine and diphosphatidylglycerol.
The organisms are isolated from marine environments.
The type species of the genus is Oceanomonas doudoroffii (ATCC 27123T).
